title: Daniel Deronda
author: George Eliot
critical_reception: widely acclaimed, though controversial for its themes
influenced_books: The Portrait of a Lady by Henry James
The Jewish Question in Europe by various authors
other_notes: Daniel Deronda is notable for its exploration of Jewish identity and its critique of Victorian society, making it a pioneering work in the representation of Jewish characters in English literature.

author: Alice Walker
